p: Active illness surveillance and sample collection for cases were conducted October through May and fully captured the influenza season in Southeast Michigan in each of the study years. Data on participant, family and household characteristics, and on high-risk conditions were additionally collected by annual interview and review of each participantâ€™s electronic medical record. In the current cohort, serum specimens were also collected twice yearly during fall (November-December) and spring (May-June) for serologic testing for antibodies against influenza.
